Sentencas: We compare two conceptually different stochastic microstructure models, i.e., a graph-based model and a pluri-Gaussian model, that have been introduced to model the transport properties of three-phase microstructures occurring, e.g., in solid oxide fuel cell electrodes.
Titulo: Stochastic 3D Modeling of Three-Phase Microstructures for Predicting Transport Properties: A Case Study

Sentencas: Besides comparing both models, we present new results regarding the relationship between model parameters and certain microstructure characteristics.
Titulo: Stochastic 3D Modeling of Three-Phase Microstructures for Predicting Transport Properties: A Case Study

Sentencas: In particular, an analytical expression is obtained for the expected length of triple phase boundary per unit volume in the pluri-Gaussian model.
Titulo: Stochastic 3D Modeling of Three-Phase Microstructures for Predicting Transport Properties: A Case Study

Sentencas: As a case study, we consider 3D image data which show a representative cutout of a solid oxide fuel cell anode obtained by FIB-SEM tomography.
Titulo: Stochastic 3D Modeling of Three-Phase Microstructures for Predicting Transport Properties: A Case Study

Sentencas: The two models are fitted to image data and compared in terms of morphological characteristics (like mean geodesic tortuosity and constrictivity) as well as in terms of effective transport properties.
Titulo: Stochastic 3D Modeling of Three-Phase Microstructures for Predicting Transport Properties: A Case Study

Sentencas: The Stokes flow in the pore phase and effective conductivities in the solid phases are computed numerically for realizations of the two models as well as for the 3D image data using Fourier methods.
Titulo: Stochastic 3D Modeling of Three-Phase Microstructures for Predicting Transport Properties: A Case Study

Sentencas: The local and effective physical responses of the model realizations are compared to those obtained from 3D image data.
Titulo: Stochastic 3D Modeling of Three-Phase Microstructures for Predicting Transport Properties: A Case Study

Sentencas: Finally, we assess the accuracy of the two methods to predict permeability as well as electronic and ionic conductivities of the anode.
Titulo: Stochastic 3D Modeling of Three-Phase Microstructures for Predicting Transport Properties: A Case Study
